task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 333°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will first look up to find the roof.
I have seen the top of the building; now I need to look down to see the base to estimate the full height.

I have now seen the top and the bottom of the building; I can count approximately 7 floors, and assuming a standard floor height of about 3.5 meters including the ground floor, I estimate the total height to be around 24.5 meters.
